Referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to provide meals and meal supplements for children in afterschool care, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Afterschool Meals Act of 2022.

section.header: Meals and meal supplements for children in afterschool care
section.text: Section 17A of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1759a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the section heading, by insert meals and before meal supplements;
in subsection (a)(1), by inserting meals and before meal supplements;
in subsection (b), by inserting meals and before supplements;

subparagraph.text: by striking section 17(c)(3) each place it appears and inserting section 17(c);

clause.text: by inserting a meal or before a supplement; and
in subparagraph (A), by inserting meals and before supplements; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by inserting meals and before supplements; and

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (d) and inserting the following:

subsection.header: Contents of meals and meal supplements
subsection.text: With respect to programs operated under this section, the requirements that apply to—

paragraph.text: the content of lunches and suppers served under the school lunch program under this Act shall apply to the content of lunches and suppers served under such programs;

the content of breakfasts served under the school breakfast program under section 4 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1773) shall apply to the content of the breakfasts served under such programs; and
meal supplements served under child care food programs operated with assistance under this Act shall apply to the content of meal supplements served under such programs.

subsection.text: Before approving a school or a program to operate under this section, the State agency shall confirm that an institution is not currently providing meals to the program under section 17(r).
